reasoning: Dry AMD is a chronic progressive condition affecting elderly populations; prevalence is the appropriate metric. Global prevalence estimated at ~310 per 100k based on age-specific rates from major epidemiological studies, heavily weighted toward adults aged 60+. Dry form represents approximately 80% of all AMD cases.
source: Congdon N et al. (2004). Causes and prevalence of visual impairment among adults in the United States. Arch Ophthalmol. 122(4):477-485; WHO disease burden estimates
